IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: CHARITABLY FUND LANGUAGE SERVICES, EDUCATIONAL SCHOLARSHIPS AND DISASTER RELIEF.
IRS990.MissionDescription: TO FUND CHILDHOOD LANGUAGE DISORDER PROGRAMS, AWARD SCHOLARSHIPS FOR UNDER-GRADUATE AND ADVANCED DEGREES, AND FUND NATURAL DISASTER RELIEF EFFORTS.
IRS990.Description: AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS AND MAKING CONTRIBUTIONS TO NATURAL DISASTER RELIEF EFFORTS AND STATE SCOTTISH RITE FOUNDATIONS.

OtherLiabilities.Description: DUE TO HOUSE OF THE TEMPLE

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF THREE INDIVIDUAL DONOR-RESTRICTED PERMANENT ENDOWMENT FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR DIFFERENT PURPOSES. THE INVESTMENT INCOME FROM THE SOVEREIGN GRAND COMMMANDER (SGC) SCHOLARSHIP FUND IS RESTRICTED FOR ANNUAL SCHOLARSHIPS. INVESTMENT INCOME FROM THE HENRY YASKAL FOUNDATION IS RESTRICTED FOR THE CHILD LEARNING DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM. INVESTMENT INCOME FROM THE BICHON ENDOWMENT FUND IS UNRESTRICTED.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION IS EXEMPT FROM INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. THE FOUNDATION IS CLASSIFIED BY THE INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE (IRS) AS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION UNDER SECTION 509(A)(1) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE. DURING THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2010, THE FOUNDATION DETERMINED THAT IT DID NOT HAVE ANY UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME. IN ADDITION, THE FOUNDATION BELIEVES THAT IT HAS APPROPRIATE SUPPORT FOR ANY TAX POSITION TAKEN, AND AS SUCH, DOES NOT HAVE ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT ARE MATERIAL TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS FOR THE YEAR ENDED DECEMBER 31, 2010.

RecipientNameBusiness.BusinessNameLine1: THE HOUSE OF THE TEMPLE HISTORIC PRESERVATION FOUNDATION INC

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING GRANTS IN THE U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: THE SCOTTISH RITE FOUNDATION RECEIVES ANNUAL FINANCIAL REPORTS FROM THE ENTITIES RECEIVING GRANTS FROM THE FOUNDATION. AS PART OF THE REPORTING PROCESS, THE ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVING GRANTS REPORT TO THE FOUNDATION BOARD MEMBERS WHO ARE ASSIGNED TO THE RECIPIENT'S AREA, THESE BOARD MEMBERS THEN ISSUE REPORTS BACK TO THE FOUNDATION.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: WILLIAM SIZEMORE RECEIVES AN ANNUITY FROM THE PENSION PLAN.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 WILL BE REVIEWED BY THE FINANCE CHAIRMAN/TREASURER, PRESIDENT, SECRETARY, AND CFO PRIOR TO THE FILING OF THE FORM 990. THE COMPLETED FORM 990 WILL BE SENT TO THE ENTIRE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO THE FILING OF THE RETURN.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH OFFICER, TRUSTEE AND MEMBER MUST DISCLOSE TO THE PRESIDENT ANY FINANCIAL INTEREST THAT COULD GIVE RISE TO CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND SHALL AFFIRM IN WRITING TO THE PRESIDENT, WHO IS REQUIRED TO MAKE THE SAME DISCLOSURE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CHAIRMAN OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE RECEIVES THE COMPENSATION INFORMATION FOR ALL OFFICERS OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE CHAIRMAN COMPARES THESE SALARIES TO INDUSTRY NORMS AND MAKES A RECOMMENDATION TO THE FULL FINANCE COMMITTEE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CHANGES IN NET ASSETS OR FUND BALANCES:

GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOUNDATION PREPARES ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ON A MODIFIED CASH BASIS OF ACCOUNTING, WHICH IS A COMPREHENSIVE BASIS OF ACCOUNTING RATHER THAN ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES GENERALLY ACCEPTED IN THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA. CONSEQUENTLY, CERTAIN REVENUE IS RECOGNIZED WHEN RECEVED RATHER THAN WHEN EARNED OR PROMISED AND EXPENSES ARE RECOGNIZED WHEN PAID RATHER THAN WHEN THE OBLIGATION IS INCURRED. ASSETS AND LIABILITIES ARISING FROM TRANSACTIONS THAT ARE ALSO RECORDED INCLUDE: (1) AMOUNTS RECEIVABLE FROM OR PAYABLES TO AFFILIATES, (2) ASSETS HELD FOR ANNUITIES OR UNDER TURST, AND (3)THE COST (OR FAIR VALUE AT THE DATE OF DONATION )OF PROPERTY AND EQUIPMENT.

NameOfDisregardedEntity.BusinessNameLine1: SUPREME COUNCIL 33 AASR OF FREEMASONRY SJ USA
THE HOUSE OF THE TEMPLE HISTORIC PRESERVATION SOCIETY
